meaningMnemonic: The <radical>mouth</radical> of that <radical>turkey</radical> is <kanji>solely</kanji> his. It’s very unique, so that mouth could belong to no other turkey but him. That mouth is solely his.
readingMnemonic: You traveled a long way to see this turkey and the mouth that is <kanji>solely</kanji> his but you missed your exit on the highway and you have to hang a <reading>U-ey</reading> (ゆい). You know what hang a U-ey means, right? It’s making a U-turn. Well, you have to hang a U-ey on the highway so you can get off at the right spot to see this turkey and the mouth that is solely his.
